intro: Brachyglottis myrianthos, commonly known as the tuatara plant, is a species native to New Zealand. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal environments, thriving in sandy or gravelly soils. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring. Brachyglottis myrianthos is often found in scrubland and is adapted to the harsh conditions of its native habitat.
